content: is there a tool I can use on a codebase to quickly get an idea of which definitions and theorems depend on which ones? I want to be able to answer "why is it necessary to prove this theorem" when the code in a file is alot
If you select a theorem name in VSCode, right click on it, you can Peek the references or the call hierarchy. Is that what you mean?

I was thinking there might be something represented more like a large directed graph. But in any case, I didn't know about this "Show Call Hierarchy" feature .. Let me try and use it and see how well it works for me. So far, I wish there was a way for me to "filter out any symbols that are not defined in this current file"
Somo S. has marked this topic as resolved.
